content.question: Which of the following diagrams shows the correctly labeled activation energy, <math alttext="E sub a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, for the reaction between <math alttext="S O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 3, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Reaction Coordinate” and the vertical axis is labeled “Potential Energy.” The curve begins just above halfway up the vertical axis and initially moves horizontally to the right. About one fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, it moves upward and to the right until it reaches a peak near the top of the vertical axis, about halfway along the horizontal axis. The vertical distance from where the curve began to its peak is labeled E sub a. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches a point about one fourth of the way up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis. It then moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Reaction Coordinate” and the vertical axis is labeled “Potential Energy.” The curve begins just above halfway up the vertical axis and initially moves horizontally to the right. About one fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, it moves upward and to the right until it reaches a peak near the top of the vertical axis, about halfway along the horizontal axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches a point about one fourth of the way up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis. The vertical distance from this point to the curve’s peak is labled E sub a. The curve then moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Reaction Coordinate” and the vertical axis is labeled “Potential Energy.” The curve begins just above halfway up the vertical axis and initially moves horizontally to the right. About one fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, it moves upward and to the right until it reaches a peak near the top of the vertical axis, about halfway along the horizontal axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches a point about one fourth of the way up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis. It then moves horizontally to the right until it ends. The vertical distance between the first horizontal section of the curve and the second horizontal section of the curve is labled E sub a.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Reaction Coordinate” and the vertical axis is labeled “Potential Energy.” The curve begins about one fourth of the way up the vertical axis and initially moves horizontally to the right. About one fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, it moves upward and to the right until it reaches a peak near the top of the vertical axis, about halfway along the horizontal axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches a point about halfway up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis. The vertical distance from this point to the curve’s peak is labled E sub a. It then moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Reaction Coordinate” and the vertical axis is labeled “Potential Energy.” The curve begins just above halfway up the vertical axis and initially moves horizontally to the right. About one fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, it moves upward and to the right until it reaches a peak near the top of the vertical axis, about halfway along the horizontal axis. The vertical distance from where the curve began to its peak is labeled E sub a. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches a point about one fourth of the way up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis. It then moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
